meanings.definition: A partial refund to someone who has paid too much money for tax, rent, or a utility.
meanings.sent1: She received a rebate on her taxes after overpaying last year.
meanings.sent2: The store offered a rebate on the new washing machine.
meanings.sent3: The rebate check came just in time for her to buy a birthday gift.
meanings.sent4: Getting a rebate felt like finding money in an old jacket pocket.
meanings.sent5: The rebate was like a small financial gift from the government.

meanings.definition: A discount or deduction from the full amount of a price or debt.
meanings.sent1: He used the rebate to get a lower price on the car.
meanings.sent2: The company offered a rebate to encourage more purchases.
meanings.sent3: She felt like a savvy shopper after using the rebate at checkout.
meanings.sent4: The rebate was a shining beacon of savings in the sea of expenses.
meanings.sent5: The rebate made the expensive item suddenly affordable.
